title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan Health-West (Grand Rapids, MI) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Scheduled a phone screen with the recruiter. Once completed I was required to provide 5 references online, once completed I was told I’d hear back. All of my references provided feedback to the recruiter the same day. I never received a rejection email from them or anything. I wish they hadn’t made my references do all of that work just for me to be ghosted.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to work here?

title: Family Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan Health-West
Interview Descriptions: A multi-step systematic interview beginning with human resources.  Progressing then to a peer to peer interview followed by a several hour job shadow.  Each step taking up to two to four weeks.
Interview Questions: Describe how your past experience has prepared you for this job?

title: Human Resources Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan Health-West (Grand Rapids, MI) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Worst female recruiter I’ve ever spoke to.  Seemed new to career.  Repeated same questions over, reiterated what I said and asks to reconfirm everything. Will talk your resume to death rather than who you are and what you can contribute. God forbid you have a gap on your resume, or left a job because you were miserable at it.  You will be disqualified as a candidate.  After this experience, I would not want to work here even if there was an offer.  Even being 100 percent honest, the way they interrogate you over the littlest details,  you will even start to doubt yourself by the end. I was ready to hang up, except I was trying to remain professional.  Fix this mess and have a more meaningful process.  The people you screen and decline are still your ambassadors in the community.  Hands down worst process I’ve ever been involved in.
Interview Questions: Are you sure that’s the dates of your employment? (Then repeats everything you said to have you confirm again)

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan Health-West
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the manager then had a peer interview with 3 other staff that worked on the unit. Everyone was very kind and asked if I had any questions about the unit and answered by questions honestly.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan Health-West
Interview Descriptions: It took 1 month 2 days, 4 interviews, and a bit of negotiating, but I feel it was worth it. The HR department seemed a bit confused on 100% of all goings on with the process...but in their defense HR was short handed during this time and the entire interview process was done in reverse. Other than that the interview process was not to be taken lightly, and yet a great experience.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your past positions?  This is asked for every job listed on your resume, no matter how long ago the position was held.

title: Physician/Rheumatologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan Health-West (Grand Rapids, MI) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: over phone, they did ask about my preferences regarding general atmosphere of the practice, which is good. I didn't like when asked about my prior salary. Later I was offered a time for physical interview.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan Health-West (Wyoming, MI)
Interview Descriptions: It was brutal.  I felt like I needed a drink after I left.  The interviewer was not easy to speak with and I wanted to slug him when I left.  I would say you better be prepared to discuss almost everything about your life.  If I wasn't so stunned I would have gotten up and left.
Interview Questions: Talked to death about my previous work history.

title: Radiology Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan Health-West (Grand Rapids, MI) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I first met and interviewed with my recruiter from HR. He asked all the legal questions and a few typical interview questions, like strengths and weaknesses, etc. He was very friendly and polite, gave me a bottle of water and everything. He also gave me a printed detailed job description and had me read over it and tell him what I thought. I then met with the head of radiology, who asked me more about my work experience and what I learned from it, and more specific questions about my skills. The whole process was about one hour.
Interview Questions: When someone first meets you, what is a first impression they have of you that, after getting to know you better, they realize was not accurate?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan Health-West (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I went through a recruiter and then I met with the supervisor.  Then I went to orientation for 3 days. Then I started working the following week.I was in probation for 90 days after that I got a 15 cent raise. In November they made me resign.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work for metrohealth?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Michigan Health-West (Wyoming, MI)
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 different interviews. One with HR, one with the Manager/Assistant Manager, and then a shadow day. The shadow day consisted of following along side of the current medical assistants as they room a patient, also the front desk check in process and then lastly the check out process.
Interview Questions: There were no extremely hard or unexpected questions.

title: Materials Handler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan Health-West (Wyoming, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by a recruiter over the phone and was given a over the phone interview. I was then invited for a in person interview and if that goes well you have a meeting with the heads of the department for which you applied.
Interview Questions: What is something you need to work on? What are your long term goals? Why should we hire you?

title: Quality Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Michigan Health-West
Interview Descriptions: Peer and Manger review and can be at two different times or on the same day,  Not to complicated of a process and its not too involved.  They usually offer within the week. Fairly good about notifying of status. Salary is neg at time of offer.

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Michigan Health-West
Interview Descriptions: They will take FORVER to get back to you!!! I interviewed and they did not call me back for 6 months, I had already found a job but luckily I still wanted the job and quit my other one.
Interview Questions: They ask you how you lots questions about working as a team player.

title: Nurse Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan Health-West (Wyoming, MI) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great, it was very conversation based.  There were the usual questions such as; biggest strengths/weaknesses, past job experiences that relate to current opening, etc… Overall, it was more of a sit down, relaxed atmosphere.
Interview Questions: What past experiences relate to the current position.

title: Food Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan Health-West (Grand Rapids, MI) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews, one with HR and the final one with the Food Services Department manager. It was relatively informal since it was an entry level, nonmedical, support positions.
Interview Questions: Why would I like to work at the hospital?

title: Information Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Michigan Health-West (Cleveland, OH) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: Since I alreaddy worked here and done previous work with my current bosses it was easy. Basically I was fortunate and blessed enough to know someone to get my position.
Interview Questions: How do you think you would fit into our team.

title: Barista Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Michigan Health-West (Cleveland, OH) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions: i was called by the supervisor she said she wanted to hire me but i needed to speak with HR so i set up an appointment and went in for my drug/background test and to have my one on one got hired then had to go for orientation
Interview Questions: Why do i think im good for this position
